channel.title: Java on Arttu Viljakainen
channel.description: Recent content in Java on Arttu Viljakainen

item.title: Reference types in Java
item.description: Differences between references in Java can be explained by reachability. This is what Java API Specification says about reachability: Reachability from strongest to weakest: An object is strongly reachable if it can be reached by some thread without traversing any reference objects. A newly-created object is strongly reachable by the thread that created it. An object is softly reachable if it is not strongly reachable but can be reached by traversing a soft reference.
